ProfessionalSummary:
Results-driven Designer with 10+ years of combined experience in graphic
design, UX/UI, web and print design, branding, and marketing. Highly adaptable
and flexible who embraces teamwork but also enjoys working independently.

Name.Raw: Bachelor's Degree in Graphic Arts & Marketing

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~~   is experienced in:  Marketing; and Information Technology (User Interface).    ~~~~~~~   appears to be a low-to-mid level candidate, with 4 years of experience.

Positions.Description:
As a part of the creative team within the marketing department, I collaborated daily with copywriters, social media analysts, event directors, and investors to
create and execute effective seasonal and cyclical marketing campaigns for the distribution, acquisition, and finance of the Powersports and automotive

divisions.


• Supplemented the UI/UX department in the creation of icons and logos, wireframes, research, journey mapping, prototypes, for mobile app and desktop, and email campaigns.


• Outside of my official job duties, I assisted with photography projects, print

design, promotional and branded merchandise design, and internal audits.

Name.Raw: Nestlé Toll House Cafe by Chip
Name.Normalized: Nestlé Toll House Cafe by Chip

Positions.Description:
Conceptualized and designed national marketing campaigns that included updates or fresh designs for digital and traditional menu signage, banners,
posters, coupons, point-of-sale pieces, email campaigns, and digital designs for all social media channels.

• Responsible for the design, brand protection, and direct marketing support for all franchises across the United States and the Middle East.

Name.Raw: The University of Texas at Dallas
Name.Normalized: The University of Texas at Dallas

Positions.Description:
Collaborated with copywriters, directors, and students to develop internal web pages using standardized web templates while producing and testing
mass HTML emails and newsletters.

• Developed e-Commerce storefronts and managed the university's digital asset library.

Findings.Message: We detected that this document contained at least some data that was laid out as columns or tables. We rearranged that data to make it more usable. NEVER use columns or tables in a resume.
You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'PROFESSIONAL SKILLS'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS

and flexible who embraces teamwork but also enjoys working independently.

WORK EXPERIENCE
   ~~~~~~~   - Graphic Designer / UI/UX Assistant
Oct 2018 - May 2020

• As a part of the creative team within the marketing department, I collaborated
daily with copywriters, social media analysts, event directors, and investors to
create and execute effective seasonal and cyclical marketing campaigns for
the distribution, acquisition, and finance of the Powersports and automotive

divisions.


• Supplemented the UI/UX department in the creation of icons and logos,
wireframes, research, journey mapping, prototypes, for mobile app and
desktop, and email campaigns.


• Outside of my official job duties, I assisted with photography projects, print

design, promotional and branded merchandise design, and internal audits.


Nestlé Toll House Cafe by Chip - Graphic Designer

Jun 2017 - Oct 2018

• Conceptualized and designed national marketing campaigns that included
updates or fresh designs for digital and traditional menu signage, banners,
posters, coupons, point-of-sale pieces, email campaigns, and digital designs
for all social media channels.

• Responsible for the design, brand protection, and direct marketing support
for all franchises across the United States and the Middle East.
